message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the task of human pose transfer, which involves generating a new image of a person from an input image and a target pose. This task is closely related to computer vision (cs.CV) and graphics (cs.GR), as it involves image synthesis and manipulation. The paper also proposes a novel approach that involves estimating dense and intrinsic 3D appearance flow, which requires machine learning techniques such as deep neural networks (cs.MM) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper presents extensive experimental results to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach, which involves evaluating the performance of the model on large datasets, which is a common practice in machine learning (cs.LG).
